summary: Design and build a two-sided job marketplace app with Owner and Worker roles, including authentication, role selection, job creation and applications, chat, payments, and ratings.
architectural_notes: Two user roles: Owner and Worker with role-based permissions and navigation.
Extend user profile model to include phone number (with validation/format).
Extend job model to include workersNeeded (number of workers requested) and reflect it in create job + job details.

existing_features.title: Create the app’s screen/route structure and navigation for these screens: Splash, Login/Register, Role Select (Owner/Worker), Home, Create Job (Owner), Job List (Worker + Owner), Job Details, Profile, and Chat.

Implement authentication using Internet Identity and persist a user profile record keyed by the authenticated Principal, including selected role (Owner or Worker) and basic profile fields (e.g., display name).
Owner flow: Implement Create Job screen with form validation and submission to backend; show Owner home/dashboard actions to manage their jobs.
Worker flow: Implement Job List and Job Details UI that allows workers to browse open jobs and view full details.
Implement job applications: workers can apply to open jobs; owners can view applicants per job and accept exactly one worker (assign the job).
Implement job completion: owner can mark an Assigned job as Completed; completion timestamp is recorded.

Implement 1:1 in-app chat between the job’s owner and the assigned worker (and/or applicant, as defined by the job state), stored in the backend and displayed in the Chat screen using polling (no real-time sockets).

Implement “Get Paid” as an in-app payout record: when a job is Completed, create a payable/payout status record for the assigned worker and show it in Worker UI (e.g., Paid/Unpaid). Allow owner to mark payout as Paid (no external payment processor integration).
Implement ratings: after job completion, worker can rate the owner (e.g., 1–5 stars + optional comment). Store ratings and display owner’s aggregate rating on relevant screens (e.g., Owner profile).

Implement Profile screen: show current user’s role, principal-based identifier, editable display name, and role-specific summary (Owner: jobs created/completed; Worker: jobs applied/assigned/completed, payouts).

Choose and apply a coherent visual theme for the app (colors, typography, layout, components) that fits a job marketplace; use Tailwind + shadcn/ui components consistently across all screens (avoid a blue/purple-dominant palette).
Add and render required generated static images (logo and splash illustration) from frontend/public/assets/generated, and use them in the Splash and auth-related screens.
Collect and validate a phone number during the profile creation/registration flow (Role Select page) and send it to the backend when creating the profile.
Show the saved phone number on the Profile page and allow the user to edit and save it (alongside display name) using the same profile-save mechanism.
Allow owners to select the number of workers needed when creating a job, submit it to the backend, and display it on job details (and anywhere job summary is shown where feasible).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create app screen structure: Splash, Login/Register, Role Select (Owner/Worker), Home, Create Job, Job List, Job Details, Profile, Chat
Implement authentication for both user types (Register/Login)
Role selection flow and role-based navigation (Owner vs Worker experience)
Owner: Create job with title, description, hourly/daily type, amount, location
Owner: View applicants, accept worker, and mark job complete
Worker: Browse/view job list and job details; apply for jobs
In-app chat between worker and owner
Payments: Worker gets paid for completed jobs

Backend: Add core data models and CRUD/query methods for jobs, including fields: ownerPrincipal, title, description, payType (Hourly/Daily), amount, location, status (Open/Assigned/Completed), createdAt.
Add phone number field to registration/user profile (capture, validate, and persist)
Owner: allow selecting how many workers are needed for a job (e.g., workersNeeded field on job)
Add a phone number field to the user profile data model and persist it per authenticated Principal.
Add a "workersNeeded" (how many workers are needed) field to the Job data model, store it for each job, and return it in job queries.

projectName: Two-sided job marketplace app (Owner/Worker) with jobs, applications, chat, completion, payouts, and ratings
